question_sentence: Which virus is spreading at unusually high levels and overwhelming children’s hospitals in the US?
evidence: Hospitals across the US say they are being overwhelmed by a common respiratory virus known as RSV. As a result, pediatric hospital beds are more full now than they have been in the past two years, according to a CNN analysis.

question_sentence: Hurricane Roslyn made landfall in which country this week?
evidence: Hurricane Roslyn flooded roads and damaged buildings along Mexico’s Pacific coast with sustained winds of 120 mph.

question_sentence: Which holiday was celebrated this week?
evidence: Diwali, one of the most important festivals in Hinduism, began this week with colorful customs and celebrations. The holiday also has significance for Sikhs and Jains, and is celebrated not just in India, but in Nepal, Malaysia, Singapore and other countries with South Asian diasporas.

question_sentence: Who became the new prime minister of the United Kingdom this week?
evidence: Rishi Sunak officially took over as Britain’s Prime Minister, becoming the country’s third leader in seven weeks.

question_sentence: What percentage of Ukraine’s wind energy infrastructure has been destroyed during its war with Russia?
evidence: More than 90% of Ukraine’s wind energy infrastructure has been destroyed due to Russian attacks, according to a Ukrainian official.

question_sentence: Due to an increase in bots on its site, which platform said it is rolling out new features to help users spot fake accounts?
evidence: While often thought of as a tamer social platform for professionals and job seekers, LinkedIn is not immune to inauthentic behavior. The company said it is rolling out new features to detect sophisticated bad actors.

question_sentence: Which late Supreme Court Justice will be featured on a new US postage stamp in 2023?
evidence: Ruth Bader Ginsburg, a longtime liberal member of the high court who died at age 87 in 2020, will be featured on a forever stamp, the US Postal Service announced Monday.

question_sentence: Which company announced it is shutting down its efforts to develop self-driving cars?
evidence: Ford is pulling the plug on an effort to develop its first fully self-driving car, and it’s going to cost the automaker $2.7 billion to walk away.

question_sentence: Former defense secretary Ash Carter died at 68 this week, his family said. Which president did he serve under?
evidence: Carter led the Defense Department under former President Barack Obama from February 2015 to January 2017.

question_sentence: Corporate America is canceling Kanye West. Among the companies that cut ties with the rapper, which one cost him the most money — and his status as a billionaire?
evidence: West’s Adidas deal accounted for $1.5 billion of his net worth but after his falling out with the company due to his antisemitic comments, Forbes now estimates West’s net worth is $400 million.

question_sentence: Rishi Sunak was selected prime minister by Britain's Conservative Party this week. How many people have held that office in the last six years?
Pest control company Orkin ranked the most mice-and-rat-infested metropolitan regions in the U.S. Which city isn't in the top 10?
The Philadelphia Phillies are back in the World Series this week for the first time since:
Which of these filmmakers was named a co-chairman and CEO of the newly formed DC Studios?
The founder of which company is giving their business away, saying “wealth is a curse”?
A photo of a dad who came directly from work to join his son at a Kentucky Wildcats basketball game went viral. What does he do for a living?
Climate activists in Europe again threw food at fine art in protest of fossil fuels. What was splattered on glass protecting a Monet painting?
Beloved Emmy-winning actor Leslie Jordan, 67, was found dead in his car following a crash this week. He had a role in all of these except:
Three Florida men were charged with stealing millions of dollars worth of what product from across the Midwest?
After show producers spotted his macabre, yet hilarious videos, a Kentucky man known for playing "dead" on TikTok was cast on which show?
Rishi Sunak attended which elite private school?
evidence: The £45,000-a-year school has produced six chancellors of the Exchequer and now two prime ministers.

question_sentence: A 2013 poll found the Ford Fiesta was the most popular car to have what in, according to The Sun?
evidence: Ford has confirmed it will end production of the UK’s all-time bestselling car next June.

question_sentence: What is the name of Rishi Sunak’s family dog?
evidence: The fox red labrador retriever will be the latest famous pet to live at No. 10, joining “chief mouser” Larry the Cat.

question_sentence: What animal has been born in the wild in the UK for the first time in 6,000 years?
evidence: The calf was spotted by two rangers in a Kent woodland, where three female bison – none of which were known to be pregnant – were introduced in July as part of a rewilding project.

question_sentence: Which high street supermarket is threatening to permanently close its flagship London store if it is not allowed to demolish and rebuild it?
evidence: M&S, which has had a difficult few years, said it was “unsustainable” to continue trading on its current Oxford Street site. But the demolition plan has prompted fierce opposition and a public inquiry is under way.

question_sentence: Bob Geldof criticised the use of what term when speaking to Radio Times this week?
evidence: The former pop star, who organised the Live Aid concert that helped raise £150m for famine relief, said: “Black saviours, white saviours, green saviours, I’m with them all.”

question_sentence: The average cost of a pint in the UK could rise to what price, according to a top brewer?
evidence: Alan Mahon, chief executive of Brewgooder, said the cost of  ingredients such as wheat and barley were rising faster than the rate of inflation, and energy prices are reaching “eye-watering levels”.

question_sentence: What did US President Joe Biden say was a “legitimate concern” for voters ahead of the US midterm elections?
evidence: Biden is expected to run for re-election in 2024 and would be 86 if he completed a second term. He admitted in an interview he could “drop dead tomorrow”.

question_sentence: What percentage of UK schools are expected to run out of money by next year?
evidence: Nine out of ten schools will have run out of money by the next school year as the “enormous burden” of increased energy bills and salaries “takes its toll”, reported The Observer this week.

question_sentence: Which rock ’n’ roll megastar was erroneously reported dead this week?
evidence: TMZ initially claimed that Lewis, 87, had died at home in Memphis. But Lewis’s representative later told Page Six: “He’s alive. TMZ reported erroneously off of a bulls*** anonymous tip.”
